metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8845 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The tm_reclaim_thread function in arch/powerpc/kernel/process.c in theLinux kernel before 4.4.1 on powerpc platforms does not ensure that TMsuspend mode exists before proceeding with a tm_reclaim call, which allowslocal users to cause a denial of service (TM Bad Thing exception and panic)via a crafted application.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8845` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.3.0-5.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.3.0-5.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.3.0-5.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required
